004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PS4Controller;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
010
011/**
012 * A subclass of {@link PS4Controller} with {@link Trigger} factories for command-based.
013 *
014 * @see PS4Controller
015 */
016@SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
017public class CommandPS4Controller extends PS4Controller {
018  /**
019   * Construct an instance of a device.
020   *
021   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the device is plugged into.
022   */
023  public CommandPS4Controller(int port) {
024    super(port);
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Constructs an event instance around the L2 button's digital signal.
029   *
030   * @return an event instance representing the L2 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
031   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
032   */
033  public Trigger L2() {
034    return L2(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
035  }
036
037  @Override
038  public Trigger L2(EventLoop loop) {
039    return super.L2(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Constructs an event instance around the R2 button's digital signal.
044   *
045   * @return an event instance representing the R2 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
046   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
047   */
048  public Trigger R2() {
049    return R2(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
050  }
051
052  @Override
053  public Trigger R2(EventLoop loop) {
054    return super.R2(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Constructs an event instance around the L1 button's digital signal.
059   *
060   * @return an event instance representing the L1 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
061   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
062   */
063  public Trigger L1() {
064    return L1(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
065  }
066
067  @Override
068  public Trigger L1(EventLoop loop) {
069    return super.L1(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Constructs an event instance around the R1 button's digital signal.
074   *
075   * @return an event instance representing the R1 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
076   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
077   */
078  public Trigger R1() {
079    return R1(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
080  }
081
082  @Override
083  public Trigger R1(EventLoop loop) {
084    return super.R1(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Constructs an event instance around the L3 button's digital signal.
089   *
090   * @return an event instance representing the L3 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
091   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
092   */
093  public Trigger L3() {
094    return L3(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
095  }
096
097  @Override
098  public Trigger L3(EventLoop loop) {
099    return super.L3(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Constructs an event instance around the R3 button's digital signal.
104   *
105   * @return an event instance representing the R3 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
106   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
107   */
108  public Trigger R3() {
109    return R3(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
110  }
111
112  @Override
113  public Trigger R3(EventLoop loop) {
114    return super.R3(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Constructs an event instance around the square button's digital signal.
119   *
120   * @return an event instance representing the square button's digital signal attached to the
121   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
122   */
123  public Trigger square() {
124    return square(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
125  }
126
127  @Override
128  public Trigger square(EventLoop loop) {
129    return super.square(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Constructs an event instance around the cross button's digital signal.
134   *
135   * @return an event instance representing the cross button's digital signal attached to the {@link
136   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
137   */
138  public Trigger cross() {
139    return cross(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
140  }
141
142  @Override
143  public Trigger cross(EventLoop loop) {
144    return super.cross(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Constructs an event instance around the circle button's digital signal.
149   *
150   * @return an event instance representing the circle button's digital signal attached to the
151   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
152   */
153  public Trigger circle() {
154    return circle(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
155  }
156
157  @Override
158  public Trigger circle(EventLoop loop) {
159    return super.circle(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
160  }
161
162  /**
163   * Constructs an event instance around the share button's digital signal.
164   *
165   * @return an event instance representing the share button's digital signal attached to the {@link
166   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
167   */
168  public Trigger share() {
169    return share(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
170  }
171
172  @Override
173  public Trigger share(EventLoop loop) {
174    return super.share(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Constructs an event instance around the PS button's digital signal.
179   *
180   * @return an event instance representing the PS button's digital signal attached to the {@link
181   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
182   */
183  public Trigger PS() {
184    return PS(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
185  }
186
187  @Override
188  public Trigger PS(EventLoop loop) {
189    return super.PS(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Constructs an event instance around the options button's digital signal.
194   *
195   * @return an event instance representing the options button's digital signal attached to the
196   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
197   */
198  public Trigger options() {
199    return options(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
200  }
201
202  @Override
203  public Trigger options(EventLoop loop) {
204    return super.options(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Constructs an event instance around the touchpad's digital signal.
209   *
210   * @return an event instance representing the touchpad's digital signal attached to the {@link
211   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
212   */
213  public Trigger touchpad() {
214    return touchpad(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
215  }
216
217  @Override
218  public Trigger touchpad(EventLoop loop) {
219    return super.touchpad(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
220  }
221}
